title: Dajae
text:
Karen Gordon, better known by her stage name Dajae (), is a female <a href="R%26amp%3BB">R&B</a> and <a href="dance%20music">dance music</a> singer born in <a href="Chicago%2C%20Illinois">Chicago, Illinois</a>.
Biography.
Dajae sang in various soul bands for over a decade prior to joining <a href="house%20music">house music</a> producer <a href="Green%20Velvet">Cajmere</a>, who featured her on his 1992 single "Brighter Days", which peaked at number two for two weeks on the American dance chart. "<a href="Time%20%28Dajae%20song%29">Time</a>", "<a href="U%20Got%20Me%20Up">U Got Me Up</a>" and "<a href="Is%20It%20All%20over%20My%20Face">Is It All over My Face</a>" were also hit singles. Her only album, "<a href="Higher%20Power%20%28Dajae%20album%29">Higher Power</a>" (1995), released on Cajual Records, followed. In 1996, her hit "<a href="Day%20by%20Day%20%28Dajae%20song%29">Day by Day</a>" hit #1 on the <a href="Hot%20Dance%20Music/Club%20Play">Hot Dance Music/Club Play</a> chart.
She also collaborated on club hits with <a href="Barbara%20Tucker">Barbara Tucker</a>, <a href="Ultra%20Nate">Ultra Naté</a>, <a href="Mon%C3%A9">Moné</a>, <a href="Full%20Intention">Full Intention</a> and <a href="Junior%20Sanchez">Junior Sanchez</a>.
